intro: Doliocarpus foreroi, commonly known as the Forero's doliocarpus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed, and it is adapted to thrive in humid, lowland environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
